title: To what extent was nationalism the cause of German unification in 1871? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is not paranoia when they are really after you. There was a measured, peaceful German unification movement. However none of the big powers in Europe wanted a new geopolitical rival in their midst. At the time, a nationalist was simply a patriot that had thought things through.
Bismarck wanted to prevent German nationalism from engulfing the Prussian monarchy. So he manipulated it to dreate a German nation in the Prussian momarchical image. Sadly, they let him.
